words.definition: To allocate something means to give it to someone for a particular purpose.
words.example: The government allocated money for the building of new schools.

words.definition: If food is appetizing, it looks and smells like it will taste good.
words.example: The freshly baked bread smelled very appetizing.

words.definition: A blizzard is a severe snowstorm with strong winds.
words.example: The city was shut down because of the heavy blizzard.

words.definition: A cavity is a hole or space inside something.
words.example: The dentist found a small cavity in one of my teeth.

words.definition: If something moves clockwise, it moves in the same direction as the hands of a clock.
words.example: Turn the key clockwise to lock the door.

words.definition: Concentric circles or shapes have the same center.
words.example: The target had several concentric circles on it.

words.definition: Courtesy is polite behavior that shows respect for other people.
words.example: He treated everyone with great courtesy and respect.

words.definition: If food is crisp, it is hard and breaks easily.
words.example: The lettuce in the salad was very fresh and crisp.

words.definition: Discord is a lack of agreement or harmony between people.
words.example: The new law caused a lot of discord among the citizens.

words.definition: If something is frigid, it is extremely cold.
words.example: The water in the lake was frigid, even in the summer.

words.definition: To generate something means to produce or create it.
words.example: The solar panels generate electricity for the house.

words.definition: If something is glacial, it relates to glaciers or is extremely cold.
words.example: The hikers were amazed by the beauty of the glacial valley.

words.definition: An interchange is an exchange of things or ideas between people.
words.example: The conference allowed for an interchange of ideas among scientists.

words.definition: A locker is a small metal cupboard with a lock.
words.example: I put my gym clothes in my locker before going to class.

words.definition: If a place is multicultural, it includes people from many different cultures.
words.example: The city is known for its vibrant multicultural community.

words.definition: An omission is something that has been left out or not done.
words.example: The omission of his name from the list was a mistake.

words.definition: To oversee something means to be in charge of it and make sure it is done correctly.
words.example: It was her job to oversee the entire project.

words.definition: To pierce something means to make a hole in it with a sharp object.
words.example: She decided to get her ears pierced.

words.definition: To replicate something means to do it again or copy it exactly.
words.example: The scientists tried to replicate the results of the experiment.

words.definition: If something is wavy, it has many curves or waves.
words.example: She has beautiful wavy hair.
